meanings.definition: Not modest or decent in behavior, speech, dress, etc.
meanings.sent1: She wore an immodest outfit to the party, causing many to stare.
meanings.sent2: It is considered immodest to speak loudly in a library.
meanings.sent3: The immodest cat meowed loudly during the solemn ceremony.
meanings.sent4: His immodest behavior at the dinner table raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent5: The immodest painting shocked the conservative art critics.

meanings.definition: Excessive or exaggerated in one's opinions or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her immodest claims about her abilities were hard to believe.
meanings.sent2: He made an immodest display of his wealth by buying extravagant gifts.
meanings.sent3: The immodest squirrel claimed all the nuts in the park as his own.
meanings.sent4: The immodest storm flooded the streets with its heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The immodest boast about his achievements made everyone roll their eyes.
